CHAPTER 9.22
INTERFERENCE WITH MEDICAL PERSONNEL
SECTION:
9.22.010: Prohibited
9.22.010: PROHIBITED:
A.   It is unlawful and an offense for any person to intentionally and wilfully
interfere with a physician, physician's trained assistant, nurse, nurse's aide,
paramedic, emergency medical technician, or other medical or hospital personnel
in the performance of their duties relating to the care and treatment of
patients in any hospital, clinic, other medical facility, or at the scene of a
medical emergency.
B.   Any person who violates the provisions of this section shall, upon
conviction be fined one hundred dollars ($100.00) plus court costs. (Ord. 730
§1, 1992)
III.   OFFENSES AGAINST THE PUBLIC DECENCY
CHAPTER 9.26
OFFENSES INVOLVING ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES
SECTION:
9.26.010: Prohibited
9.26.020: Sale To Minors
9.26.030: Possession Prohibitions
9.26.040: Consumption
9.26.050: Permitting Or Allowing Gatherings Where Minors Are Consuming
Alcoholic Beverages
9.26.010: PROHIBITED:
It shall be unlawful and an offense for any person to be intoxicated or drunk
in any street, avenue, alley or other public place or upon private property not
lawfully under his control in the city. (Ord. 661 §1, 1987)
9.26.020: SALE TO MINORS:
It is unlawful and an offense for any person selling intoxicating or
nonintoxicating alcoholic beverages for consumption on or off of the premises
to sell any such alcoholic beverages to any minor under the age of twenty one
(21) years. (Ord. 632A §1, 1986)
9.26.030: POSSESSION PROHIBITIONS:
A.   It shall be unlawful and an offense for any person under twenty one (21)
years of age to be in possession of any intoxicating beverage containing more
than 3.2 percent alcohol, by weight, while such person is upon any public
street, avenue, alley, road, highway, or other public place, or upon private
property not lawfully under his control in the city.
B.   It shall be unlawful and an offense for any person under twenty one (21)
years of age to be in possession of any nonintoxicating alcoholic beverages, as
defined by the Oklahoma Statutes in title 37, section 163.1, on any public
street, avenue, alley, road, highway, or other public place, or upon private
property not lawfully under his control in the city. (Ord. 661 §1, 1987)
9.26.040: CONSUMPTION:
A.   It shall be unlawful and an offense for any person to consume any
intoxicating beverage containing more than 3.2 percent alcohol by weight or to
consume any low point alcohol (3.2 beer) in any public place within the city.
B.   It shall be unlawful and an offense for any person to consume any
intoxicating beverage containing more than 3.2 percent alcohol by weight or to
consume any low point alcohol (3.2 beer) in any of the city parks or on
property owned by the city, including property under lease by the city for
recreational purposes.
C.   The possession of the above referenced alcoholic beverage on the person of
any individual in the city where the container has been opened, the seal
broken, or the original cap or cork has been removed, shall be presumption of
drinking the alcoholic beverage in a public place within the city.
D.   Any persons found guilty, pleading guilty or pleading nolo contendere
before the municipal court to a violation of this section shall be punishable
by a fine in the amount not to exceed one hundred dollars ($100.00) plus court
costs. (Ord. 970 §1, 2002)
9.26.050: PERMITTING OR ALLOWING GATHERINGS WHERE MINORS ARE CONSUMING
ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES:
A.   Definitions: For purposes of this section, the following definitions shall
apply:
   ALCOHOL: Ethyl alcohol, hydrated oxide of ethyl, or spirits of wine, from
whatever source or by whatever process produced.
   ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGE: Includes alcohol, spirits, liquor, wine, beer, and every
liquid or solid containing alcohol, spirits, wine, or beer, and which contains
one-half of one percent or more of alcohol by volume or when diluted, mixed, or
combined with other substances. This term includes intoxicating beverages and
"low point beer" as defined herein.
   GATHERING: A party, gathering, or event, where a group of three (3) or more
persons have assembled or are assembling for a social occasion or social
activity.
   INTOXICATING BEVERAGE: Includes beverages containing more than three and
two-tenths percent (3.2%) alcohol by weight.
   LEGAL GUARDIAN: 1) a person who, by court order, is the guardian of the
person of a minor; or 2) a public or private agency with whom a minor has been
placed by the court.
   LOW POINT BEER: Means and includes beverages containing more than one-half
of one percent (1/2 of 1%) alcohol by volume, and not more than three and two-
tenths percent (3.2%) alcohol by weight, including, but not limited to, beer or
cereal malt beverages obtained by the alcoholic fermentation of an infusion of
barley or other grain, malt or similar products.
   MINOR: Any person under twenty one (21) years of age.
   PARENT: A person who is a natural parent, adoptive parent, foster parent, or
stepparent of another person.
   PREMISES: Any residence or other private property, place, or premises,
including any commercial or business premises.
   RESPONSE COST: The costs associated with responses by law enforcement, fire,
and other emergency response providers to a gathering, including, but not
limited to: 1) salaries and benefits of law enforcement, code enforcement,
fire, or other emergency response personnel for the amount of time spent
responding to, remaining at, or otherwise dealing with a gathering, and the
administrative costs attributable to such response(s); 2) the cost of any
medical treatment for any law enforcement, code enforcement, fire, or other
emergency response personnel injured responding to, remaining at, or leaving
the scene of a gathering; 3) the cost of repairing any city equipment or
property damaged, and the cost of the use of any such equipment, in responding
to, remaining at, or leaving the scene of a gathering; and 4) any other
allowable costs related to the enforcement of this section.
B.   Consumption Of Alcohol By Minor In Public Place, Place Open To Public, Or
Place Not Open To Public: Except as permitted by state law, it is unlawful for
any minor to:
   1.   Consume at any public place or any place open to the public, any
alcoholic beverage; or
   2.   Consume at any place not open to the public any alcoholic beverage,
unless in connection with the consumption of the alcoholic beverage that minor
is being supervised by his or her parent or legal guardian.
C.   Hosting, Permitting, Or Allowing A Party, Gathering, Or Event Where Minors
Are Consuming Alcoholic Beverages Prohibited:
   1.   Unlawful Activity:
      a.   It is the duty of any person having control of any premises, who
knowingly hosts, permits, or allows a gathering at said premises to take all
reasonable steps to prevent the consumption of alcoholic beverages by any minor
at the gathering. Reasonable steps are: controlling access to alcoholic
beverages at the gathering; controlling the quantity of alcoholic beverages
present at the gathering; verifying the age of persons attending the gathering
by inspecting drivers' licenses or other government issued identification cards
to ensure that minors do not consume alcoholic beverages while at the
gathering; and supervising the activities of minors at the gathering.
      b.   It is unlawful for any person having control of any premises to
knowingly host, permit, or allow a gathering to take place at said premises
where at least one minor consumes an alcoholic beverage, whenever the person
having control of the premises either knows a minor has consumed an alcoholic
beverage or reasonably should have known that a minor consumed an alcoholic
beverage had the person taken all reasonable steps to prevent the consumption
of an alcoholic beverage by a minor as set forth in subsection C1a of this
section.
   2.   Conduct Between Minor And Parent Or Guardian: This section shall not
apply to conduct involving the use of alcoholic beverages that occurs
exclusively between a minor and his or her parent or legal guardian.
   3.   Family Gathering: Nothing in this section should be interpreted to
prohibit any family activity held in the confines of the family home from
providing the use of alcohol to immediate family members within the supervision
of parents and guardians. However, if a minor leaves such a family gathering
intoxicated and is found in public then said providers of alcohol will be held
responsible in the same manner as a nonfamily gathering.
   4.   Religious Gathering: Nothing in this section should be interpreted to
prohibit any religious practice which includes the use of alcohol. However, if
a minor leaves such a religious gathering intoxicated and is found to be in
public then said providers of alcohol will be held responsible in the manner as
a nonreligious gathering.
   5.   Premises Licensed By The State: This section shall not apply to any
premises licensed by the state of Oklahoma to dispense alcoholic beverages.
   6.   Penalty: Any person who shall violate the provisions of this section
shall be deemed guilty of an offense against the city and upon conviction
thereof shall be punished for the violation with a fine of five hundred dollars
($500.00), plus court costs. (Ord. 1094, 9-21-2010)
CHAPTER 9.28
GAMBLING
SECTION:
9.28.010: Prohibited
9.28.020: Paraphernalia Declared A Nuisance
9.28.030: Possession Of Paraphernalia
9.28.040: Confiscation Of Paraphernalia
9.28.050: Destruction Of Paraphernalia
9.28.060: Pools
9.28.010: PROHIBITED:
It is unlawful for any person or persons in the city to deal, play, carry on,
set up, or keep on his or their premises for play, or open, cause to be opened,
or conduct, either as owner, employee or lessee, whether for hire or not, any
lottery or any game in which the winning or reward is money or any
representative thereof, or any other thing of value; and no person or persons
shall conduct or play at any game of faro, money, roulette, keno, or any game
played with cards, dice, or any other device, for money, checks, credit,
merchandise, or any other representative of value. This general prohibition
found in this section shall not apply to bingo games conducted under and
pursuant to title 21, section 995.1 et seq., of the Oklahoma Statutes and under
a special use permit and business permit granted pursuant to this code. (Ord.
645 §2, 1986)
9.28.020: PARAPHERNALIA DECLARED A NUISANCE:
Any property, instrument, or device designed or adapted for use, or which may
be used, in the city in any game, drawing, or lottery, the reward or winning of
which is money or any other thing of value, or which is used or kept in any
gambling house in the city as a convenience or accessory to the patrons or
habitues of any room or house used for gaming or gambling purposes, whether the
same was designed, constructed, or built for such purpose or not, is a
nuisance; and it is unlawful for any person, firm or corporation, either as
owner, manager, clerk, or employee, to keep, have in his or their possession,
or permit to be kept on his or their premises in the city any instrumentality
or device designed or adapted for use in any game, drawing, or lottery where
the reward or winning is money, or any other representative of or thing of
value. (Prior code §13-2)
9.28.030: POSSESSION OF PARAPHERNALIA:
Possession in the city by any person, or the keeping or custody by any person,
of any property designed, constructed or built for the purpose of being used as
a gambling device or instrumentality shall be prima facie evidence that the
possessor or keeper thereof intended to use such device in violation of this
chapter and against the peace and welfare of the people of the city; and the
keeping or custody of any device or instrumentality which may be used for
gaming or gambling purposes, on or within any place, house, or room ordinarily
devoted to and used for gaming or gambling purposes shall be prima facie
evidence that such device or instrumentality was being kept and used as a
gambling device; and the fact that any person is apprehended or caught
loitering or staying about or in any place, house, or room in the city used for
the purpose of gaming and gambling, or reputed to be such, shall be prima facie
evidence that such person was at such place for the purpose of gambling, and in
violation of this chapter. (Prior code §13-3)
9.28.040: CONFISCATION OF PARAPHERNALIA:
It shall be the duty of any police officer who discovers or has knowledge of
the use, or existence of any gaming or gambling instrumentality or device,
described, referred to, or mentioned in this chapter as unlawful, to seize the
same and safely keep it until the next session of the municipal court, when it
shall be produced in the presence of the municipal judge, to be done with as
directed under this chapter, and any police or other officer of the city shall
have and is vested with the power and authority, either with or without writ or
process, to enter any room, house, or building where any offense prohibited by
this chapter is being committed, or any such room, house, or building as is
commonly known to be conducted in violation of this chapter, and shall without
writ or process take and keep possession of any property prohibited by this
chapter as being gambling instrumentalities or as used as a convenience or
accessory thereto. (Prior code §13-4)
9.28.050: DESTRUCTION OF PARAPHERNALIA:
Whenever there is produced in the presence of the municipal judge any property,
instrumentality, or device, and it is shown to the municipal judge that the
property, instrumentality, or device was designed, constructed, or built for
the purpose of being used for gambling, or as an accessory or convenience to
any gaming or gambling house, or to the owner, keeper or habitues of any room
or house used for gambling or gaming purposes; or if the municipal judge finds
that such property was used or kept for use in any game in which the reward or
winning was or should be money, merchandise, credit, or any other thing of
value, then the municipal judge shall order that the property be forthwith, by
the chief of police or other officer, publicly burned and destroyed, and the
officer so directed by the municipal judge shall immediately destroy the same.
(Prior code §13-5)
9.28.060: POOLS:
All owners, tenants, or occupants, their agents, servants, or employees, or any
building, or room or apartment in any building within the limits of the city
are prohibited from using the same or allowing the same to be used by any
person or persons for the purpose of carrying on therein the selling of pools
of any kind upon horseraces, baseball games, prizefights or contests occurring
or about to occur in this city or state or any other city or state, or where
persons are invited or do congregate to wager any money or valuable thing or
representative of value thereon. (Prior code §13-6)
CHAPTER 9.30
SLOT MACHINES; PINBALL MACHINES 1
SECTION:
9.30.010: Operation Prohibited; Nuisance
9.30.020: Playing Prohibited
9.30.030: Exemptions
9.30.040: Confiscation
 
Notes
1 1. 21 OS § 964 et seq.; 68 OS art. 15.
9.30.010: OPERATION PROHIBITED; NUISANCE:
It is unlawful and an offense for any person, firm or corporation to operate or
be in control of the operation of any mechanical device, contrivance or
instrumentality ordinarily known as a "slot machine", a "one ball machine", or
a "marble table", and a "slot machine", "one ball machine" or "marble table" is
defined to be any machine which may be played by others for money, property,
checks, credits, or any representative of value, or any machine which vends
merchandise in varying quantities, such quantities in any way depending upon
chance. Such slot machines, one ball machines or marble tables are public
nuisances as being gambling devices and unlawful and against the welfare of the
city, and may be abated as provided in the ordinances of the city relating to
slot machines. (Prior code §13-73)
9.30.020: PLAYING PROHIBITED:
It is unlawful and an offense for any person to deposit any coin or slug for
the purpose of playing the same in any mechanical device known as a slot
machine, one ball machine and/or marble table machine, as described in section
9.30.010 of this chapter, or to play at, or exhibit or be in charge of any card
raffle or lottery or game of chance, whether the winning is money, merchandise,
checks, tokens, or other evidence of winning. (Prior code §13-74)
9.30.030: EXEMPTIONS:
Vending machines and automatic salesmen machines which do nothing more than
store merchandise or other commodities and deliver a stated amount upon deposit
of a coin therein, when licensed under the ordinances of the city, shall not be
deemed "slot machines" within the terms of section
9.30.010 of this chapter. (Prior code §13-75)
9.30.040: CONFISCATION:
It shall be the duty of any police officer of the city to seize and take charge
of any machine operated or used in violation of sections
9.30.010 and
9.30.020 of this chapter, and convey the same to the presence of the municipal
judge; and if the municipal judge finds upon a hearing that such machine was
used in violation of this chapter he shall declare the same a nuisance and
unlawful and shall order it destroyed forthwith in such manner and form as he
shall prescribe. (Prior code §13-76)
CHAPTER 9.32
PROSTITUTION 1
SECTION:
9.32.010: Consorting For Immoral Purpose
9.32.020: Indecent Conduct
9.32.030: Soliciting In Public Places
9.32.040: Unlawful Acts Designated
9.32.050: Consorting With Prostitute
 
Notes
1 1. 21 OS ch. 42.
9.32.010: CONSORTING FOR IMMORAL PURPOSE:
It is unlawful and an offense for any person within the city to consort with
another of the opposite sex for an immoral purpose in any room, building,
dwelling, hotel, rooming house, street, sidewalk, or any other place, or to
occupy the same for an immoral purpose. (Prior code §13-44)
9.32.020: INDECENT CONDUCT:
It is unlawful and an offense for any prostitute, or any woman who has the
reputation of being a prostitute, to conduct herself in such an unseemly, lewd,
boisterous, or indecent manner, in walking or riding through the streets,
thoroughfares, and public places of the city, as to call attention to either
her immoral character or business, or to wear any gaudy, flashy or unusual
clothing calculated to attract or direct attention to herself, or which
suggests her avocation or character.
It is unlawful for any person to conduct himself or herself in such unseemly,
lewd, boisterous or indecent manner as to be offensive to the good morals of
the city, either by word, act, or exposure of person. (Prior code §13-43)
9.32.030: SOLICITING IN PUBLIC PLACES:
It is unlawful and an offense for any woman to go about the streets,
thoroughfares, parks, or other public places in the city or to go into or
frequent any residence, place of business, or other place in the city, at any
time, for the purpose of calling attention to or soliciting any business or
patronage for immoral purposes. (Prior code §13-45)
9.32.040: UNLAWFUL ACTS DESIGNATED:
It is unlawful and an offense, in the city, for any person to approach or speak
to any other person of the same or opposite sex, or by any sign or suggestion
to indicate or attempt to persuade or induce any other person to:
A.   Do or perform any immoral or unlawful act;
B.   Play at any gambling game;
C.   Purchase any obscene picture or printed matter;
D.   Go to, or enter, any room, building, or other place or enclosure wherein
unlawful or immoral acts are committed, or are to be performed;
E.   Go upon the streets, or about any public or private grounds, within the
city, for any such unlawful purpose, or for the purpose of inducing patronage
for any bawdyhouse, assignation house, or other house of ill fame;
F.   Solicit for any rooming house or hotel by suggesting the existence thereof
to persons of the opposite sex;
G.   Induce or attempt to induce any person to go to or to occupy any room or
building for any immoral or unlawful purpose;
H.   Solicit for any place where intoxicating liquors are illegally kept or
sold, or where drugs are kept or offered for unlawful sale;
I.   Accept or receive from any female the proceeds of any unlawful or immoral
act or calling. (Prior code §13-46)
9.32.050: CONSORTING WITH PROSTITUTE:
It is unlawful and an offense to be found in any public or private place of the
city consorting with or in the company with any prostitute or other person of
lewd character. (Prior code §13-42)
CHAPTER 9.34
DISORDERLY HOUSES 1
SECTION:
9.34.010: Keeping Or Maintaining
9.34.020: Pimping And Procuring
9.34.030: Inmates And Visitors
 
Notes
1 1. 21 OS §§ 1026 – 1029.
9.34.010: KEEPING OR MAINTAINING:
It is unlawful and an offense for any person in the city to keep or maintain or
aid or abet or assist in keeping or maintaining, or to occupy or use any room,
building, dwelling, hotel, rooming house, or other place for purposes of
prostitution or assignation or immoral sexual relations, or to knowingly lease,
rent, or let the same for such purposes, or to knowingly permit the same to be
used for such purposes. (Prior code §13-48)
9.34.020: PIMPING AND PROCURING:
It is unlawful and an offense for any person in the city to act as procurer,
pimp or solicitor for any bawdyhouse, house of ill fame, house of prostitution,
or house of assignation, or for any male person to solicit business for any
lewd or immoral woman. Any person who assists or persuades any female to visit
or become an inmate of any bawdyhouse, house of ill fame or house of
prostitution or assignation, or who in any manner persuades or induces any
female to leave any place in the city for the purpose of prostitution, shall be
deemed a procurer or pimp within the meaning of this section and punished as
provided in this title. (Prior code §13-49)
9.34.030: INMATES AND VISITORS:
Any person in the city, whether male or female who, is an inmate or resident of
any disorderly house, brothel, bawdyhouse, house of ill fame, or house of
assignation, and any person who is found in or visiting any such house, is
guilty of an offense, but this section shall not apply to physicians or
officers in the discharge of their professional or official duties. (Prior code
§13-50)
CHAPTER 9.36
PORNOGRAPHY AND OBSCENITY 1
SECTION:
9.36.010: Prohibited
9.36.020: Sales And Display Of Materials
9.36.030: Penalty
 
Notes
1 1. 21 OS §§ 1040.8 et seq., 1021.
9.36.010: PROHIBITED:
It is unlawful and an offense for any person, firm or corporation to wilfully
print, publish, design, prepare, import, copy, distribute, exhibit, display,
buy, lend, sell, offer to sell, give away, offer to give away, or possess with
intent to distribute, sell, lend or give away, any obscene, lewd or lascivious
book, pamphlet, magazine, paper, drawing, picture, photograph, figure, image,
or other engraved, printed or written matter, or any article or other thing of
obscene, lewd, or lascivious character or use. (Ord. 376 §2, 1974)
9.36.020: SALES AND DISPLAY OF MATERIALS:
A.   Requirements: All publications, books, pamphlets, magazines, papers,
drawings, pictures, photographs, figures, images, or other engraved, printed or
written matter, or any article or other things not characterized or construed
as obscene or pornographic, but having a connotation or influential effect as
being obscene, lewd or lascivious in character or use, including the showing
and displaying of the nude body, sexual acts, or other characters of sexuality,
if sold, may be sold, distributed and made available only to customers or
patrons over the age of eighteen (18) years, and only then from under the
counter, shelf, table or rack, completely hidden from view at all times from
persons and customers patronizing such store or place of business until the
sale has been made to the person or customer buying such item.
B.   Maintain List Or Schedule Of Materials: This chapter does permit the
proprietor, owner, or manager, however to maintain a list or schedule, by title
only, of all publications of this kind and nature in the store or place of
business on display and open to public view.
C.   Displaying Material Harmful To Minors:
   1.   Definitions:
   A REASONABLE BONA FIDE ATTEMPT: An attempt to ascertain the true age of the
minor by requiring production of a driver's license, marriage certificate,
birth certificate or other governmental or educational identification card or
paper and not relying solely on the oral allegations or apparent age of the
minor.
   HARMFUL TO MINORS: That quality of any description, exhibition, presentation
or representation, in whatever form, of nudity, sexual conduct, sexual
excitement, or sadomasochistic abuse when the material or performances taken as
a whole, has the following characteristics:
      a.   The average adult person applying contemporary community standards
would find that the material or performance has a predominant tendency to
appeal to a prurient interest in sex to minors; and
      b.   The average adult person applying contemporary community standards
would find that the material or performance depicts or describes nudity, sexual
conduct, sexual excitement or sadomasochistic abuse in a manner that is
patently offensive to prevailing standards in the adult community with respect
to what is suitable for minors; and
      c.   The material or performance lacks serious literary, scientific,
artistic, or political value to minors.
   KNOWINGLY: Having general knowledge of, or reason to know, or a belief or
ground for belief which warrants further inspection or inquiry or both:
      a.   The character and content of any material or performance which is
reasonably susceptible of examination by the defendant, and
      b.   The age of the minor; however, an honest mistake shall constitute an
excuse from liability hereunder if the defendant made a bona fide attempt to
ascertain the true age of such minor.
   MATERIAL: Any book, magazine, newsletter, pamphlet, poster, print, picture,
figure, image, description, motion picture film, record or recording tape,
videotape.
   MINOR: Any unmarried person under the age of eighteen (18) years.
   NUDITY: The showing of the human male or female genitals, pubic area, or
buttocks with less than a full opaque covering; the showing of the female
breast with less than a full opaque covering of any portion thereof below the
top of the areola; or the depiction of covered male genitals in a discernibly
turgid state.
   PERFORMANCE: Any motion picture film, videotape, played record, phonograph
or tape, preview, trailer, play, show, skit, dance, or other exhibition
performed or presented to or before an audience of one or more, with or without
consideration.
   PERSON: Any individual, partnership, association, corporation, or other
legal entity, of any kind.
   SADOMASOCHISTIC ABUSE: Flagellation or torture by or upon a person clad in
undergarments, a mask or bizarre costume, or the condition of being fettered,
bound or otherwise physically restrained on the part of one so clothed.
   SEXUAL CONDUCT: Includes the following: the fondling or other touching of
human genitals, pubic region, buttocks, or female breasts; ultimate sex acts,
normal or perverted, actual or simulated, including intercourse, oral
copulation, sodomy; masturbation, and excretory functions as part of or in
connection with any of the activities set forth herein.
   SEXUAL EXCITEMENT: The condition of human male or female genitals when in a
state of sexual stimulation or arousal.
   SPECIFIED ANATOMICAL AREAS: Include the following: human genitals, pubic
region, buttocks, and female breasts below a point immediately above the top of
the areola; human genitals in a discernibly turgid state, even if completely
and opaquely covered.
   2.   Offenses: No person having custody, control or supervision of any
commercial establishment shall knowingly:
      a.   Display material which is harmful to minors in such a way that
minors, as a part of the invited general public, will be exposed to view such
material; provided, however, a person shall be deemed not to have displayed
material harmful to minors if the material is kept behind devices commonly
known as "blinder racks" so that the lower two-thirds (2/3) of the material is
not exposed to view;
      b.   Sell, furnish, present, distribute, allow to view, or otherwise
disseminate to a minor, with or without consideration, any material which is
harmful to minors; or
      c.   Present to a minor or participate in presenting to a minor, with or
without consideration, any performance which is harmful to a minor.
   3.   Defenses: It shall be an affirmative defense to any prosecution under
the ordinance certified in this subsection that:
The material or performance involved was displayed, presented or disseminated
to a minor at a recognized and established school, church, museum, medical
clinic, hospital, public library, governmental agency, quasi-governmental
agency and persons acting in their capacity as employees or agents of such
persons or organizations, and which institution displays, presents or
disseminates such material or performance for a bona fide governmental,
educational or scientific purpose. (Ord. 678 §1, 1989: Ord. 376 §3, 1974)
9.36.030: PENALTY:
Any person who shall be convicted of violating any provision of this chapter is
guilty of an offense and shall be fined a sum not exceeding one hundred dollars
($100.00). Each day that any violation of this chapter occurs or continues
shall constitute a separate offense and shall be punishable as a separate
violation. Every act, thing, or transaction prohibited by this chapter shall
constitute a separate offense as to each item, issue or title involved and
shall be punishable as such. For the purpose of this chapter, multiple copies
of the same identical title, monthly issue, volume and number or other such
identical material will constitute a single offense. (Ord. 678 §2, 1989: Ord.
376 §4, 1974)
CHAPTER 9.38
CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES AND DRUGS
SECTION:
9.38.010: Marijuana Defined
9.38.015: Affirmative Defense - Marijuana
9.38.020: Possession Of Controlled Dangerous Substances
9.38.021: Penalties For Violating Section 9.38.020 Of This Chapter
9.38.025: Possession Of Paraphernalia
9.38.026: Penalties For Violating Section 9.38.025 Of This Chapter
9.38.030: Inhalation Of Glue And Other Substances
9.38.031: Violation Of Section 9.38.030 Of This Chapter
9.38.035: Possession And Sale Of Certain Toxins
9.38.036: Exceptions
9.38.037: Permit, Application, Issuance And Form
9.38.038: Penalties
9.38.040: Sale Of Hypodermic Needle Or Syringe
9.38.045: Penalty For Violating Section 9.38.040 Of This Chapter
9.38.010: MARIJUANA DEFINED:
"Marijuana" means all parts of the plant Cannabis sativa L., whether growing or
not; the seeds thereof; the resin extracted from any part of such plant; and
every compound, manufacture, salt, derivative, mixture or preparation of such
plant, its seeds or resin, but shall not include:
A.   The mature stalks of such plant or fiber produced from such stalks,
B.   Oil or cake made from the seeds of such plant, including cannabidiol
derived from the seeds of the marijuana plant,
C.   Any other compound, manufacture, salt, derivative, mixture or preparation
of such mature stalks (except the resin extracted therefrom), including
cannabidiol derived from mature stalks, fiber, oil or cake,
D.   The sterilized seed of such plant which is incapable of germination,
E.   For any person participating in a clinical trial to administer cannabidiol
for the treatment of severe forms of epilepsy pursuant to 63 Oklahoma Statutes
section 2-802, a drug or substance approved by the Federal Food and Drug
Administration for use by those participants,
F.   For any person or the parents, legal guardians or caretakers of the person
who have received a written certification from a physician licensed in this
State that the person has been diagnosed by a physician as having Lennox-
Gastaut Syndrome, Dravet Syndrome, also known as Severe Myoclonic Epilepsy of
Infancy, or any other severe form of epilepsy that is not adequately treated by
traditional medical therapies, spasticity due to multiple sclerosis or due to
paraplegia, intractable nausea and vomiting, appetite stimulation with chronic
wasting diseases, the substance cannabidiol, a nonpsychoactive cannabinoid,
found in the plant Cannabis sativa L., or any other preparation thereof, that
has a tetrahydrocannabinol concentration of not more than three-tenths of one
percent (0.3%) and that is delivered to the patient in the form of a liquid,
G.   Any Federal Food and Drug Administration-approved cannabidiol drug or
substance, or
H.   Industrial hemp, from the plant Cannabis sativa L., and any part of such
plant, whether growing or not, with a delta-9 tetrahydrocannabinol
concentration of not more than three-tenths of one percent (0.3%) on a dry
weight basis which shall not be grown anywhere in the State of Oklahoma but may
be shipped to Oklahoma pursuant to the provisions of subsection E or F of this
section. This shall not apply to any growth which is authorized pursuant to 63
Oklahoma Statutes sections 420A - 426. (Ord. 1189, 2018)
9.38.015: AFFIRMATIVE DEFENSE - MARIJUANA:
Pursuant to State Question 788, adopted in 2018 and codified in title 63 of the
Oklahoma Statute at sections 420A through 426, no person shall be charged with
a violation of this Code for engaging in conduct which, at the time of the
alleged conduct, was lawful under Oklahoma Statutes sections 420A - 426, as
those sections may be amended or repealed. This defense shall not be available
if the alleged conduct was not in strict compliance with State Statutes in
effect on the date of the alleged conduct. (Ord. 1189, 2018)
9.38.020: POSSESSION OF CONTROLLED DANGEROUS SUBSTANCES:
It shall be unlawful for any person knowingly or intentionally to possess
marijuana or any other substance which is classified as a controlled dangerous
substance under the Oklahoma Uniform Controlled Dangerous Substances Act, 63
Oklahoma Statutes section 2-101 et seq., unless such substance was obtained
directly, or pursuant to a valid prescription or order from a practitioner,
while acting in the course of his or her professional practice, or except as
otherwise authorized by the Oklahoma Uniform Controlled Dangerous Substances
Act, title 63, section 2-101 et seq. (Ord. 1189, 2018)
9.38.021: PENALTIES FOR VIOLATING SECTION 9.38.020 OF THIS CHAPTER:
Persons convicted of violating the provisions of section
9.38.020 of this chapter shall be punished by a monetary fine in the amount of
five hundred dollars ($500.00) plus court costs. (Ord. 1000 §3, 2004: Ord. 906
§3, 2000: Ord. 551 §1, 1983)
9.38.025: POSSESSION OF PARAPHERNALIA:
A.   No person shall use or possess drug paraphernalia to plant, propagate,
cultivate, grow, harvest, manufacture, compound, convert, produce, process,
prepare, test, analyze, pack, repack, store, contain, conceal, inject, ingest,
inhale or otherwise introduce into the human body a controlled dangerous
substance in violation of the Uniform Controlled Dangerous Substances Act,
except those persons holding an unrevoked license in the professions of
podiatry, dentistry, medicine, nursing, optometry, osteopathy, veterinary
medicine or pharmacy.
B.   No person shall deliver, possess or manufacture drug paraphernalia knowing
it will be used to plant, propagate, cultivate, grow, harvest, manufacture,
compound, convert, produce, process, prepare, test, analyze, pack, repack,
store, contain, conceal, inject, ingest, inhale or otherwise introduce into the
human body a controlled dangerous substance in violation of the Uniform
Controlled Dangerous Substances Act. (Ord. 956 §1, 2002)
9.38.026: PENALTIES FOR VIOLATING SECTION 9.38.025 OF THIS CHAPTER:
Any person who shall violate any provisions of section
9.38.025 of this chapter, shall, upon conviction, be guilty of a misdemeanor
punishable by a fine of not more than two hundred dollars ($200.00), plus court
costs. (Ord. 956 §1, 2002)
9.38.030: INHALATION OF GLUE AND OTHER SUBSTANCES:
A.   It is unlawful for any person deliberately to smell, inhale, breathe,
drink or otherwise consume any compound, liquid, chemical, narcotic, drug, or
any other substance or chemical containing any ketones, aldehydes, organic
acetones, ether, chlorinated hydrocarbons, such as gasoline, glue, fingernail
polish, adhesive cement, mucilage, dope, or any other substance or combination
thereof containing solvents releasing toxic vapors, which can cause conditions
of intoxication, inebriation, excitement, elation, stupefaction, paralysis,
irrationality, dulling of the brain or nervous system, or any other changing,
distorting or disturbing of the eyesight, thinking processes, judgment, balance
or coordination of such person.
B.   The provisions of this section shall not pertain to any person who
inhales, breathes, drinks or otherwise consumes such material or substance
pursuant to the direction or prescription of any licensed doctor, physician,
surgeon, dentist or podiatrist; nor to the consumption of intoxicating liquor
in such place or manner as may be authorized and permitted by State law and
local ordinances. (Ord. 535 §§1, 2, 1982)
9.38.031: VIOLATION OF SECTION 9.38.030 OF THIS CHAPTER:
Any person who shall violate any of the provisions of section
9.38.030 of this chapter shall be deemed guilty of an offense and upon
conviction thereof shall be punishable by a fine of two hundred dollars
($200.00) plus court costs. (Ord. 906 §3, 2000: Ord. 535 §3, 1982)
9.38.035: POSSESSION AND SALE OF CERTAIN TOXINS:
It is unlawful for any person to possess, sell, distribute or to inhale or
ingest for the purpose of inducing a condition of intoxication or of distortion
or disturbance of the auditory, visual or mental processes, any compound,
liquid or chemical commonly known as "locker room" or "rush", which contains
alkyl nitrites (isopropyl nitrite, butyl nitrites [consisting mainly of
isobutyl nitrites] and/or any of its isomer or analogs) or any similar
compound, liquid or chemical. (Ord. 689 §1, 1989)
9.38.036: EXCEPTIONS:
The provisions of section
9.38.035 of this chapter shall not apply to:
A.   The possession and use of the substances listed as part of the care or
treatment of a disease, condition or injury by a licensed physician or pursuant
to a prescription of a licensed physician;
B.   The possession or sale of the substance as part of a known manufacturing
process or industrial operation when the possessor or operator has obtained a
permit from the Chief of Police. (Ord. 689 §1, 1989)
9.38.037: PERMIT, APPLICATION, ISSUANCE AND FORM:
The Chief of Police shall establish procedures for application, form and
issuance of a permit to legitimate research, manufacturing and industrial
applicants and shall have the authority to make reasonable rules in order to
carry out the intent of the ordinance codified in sections
9.38.035 through
9.38.038 of this chapter. (Ord. 689 §1, 1989)
9.38.038: PENALTIES:
Any person who violates any of the provisions of the ordinance codified in
sections
9.38.035 through
9.38.037 of this chapter shall be guilty of an offense and upon conviction of
such offense, shall be punishable by a fine not to exceed two hundred dollars
($200.00) and costs. (Ord. 689 §1, 1989)
9.38.040: SALE OF HYPODERMIC NEEDLE OR SYRINGE:
Sale of disposable or permanent type hypodermic needle or hypodermic syringe
shall be prohibited except when prescribed by a licensed physician. (Ord. 912
§1, 2000)
9.38.045: PENALTY FOR VIOLATING SECTION 9.38.040 OF THIS CHAPTER:
Any person, firm, or corporation violating any provision of section
9.38.040 of this chapter shall be guilty of an offense and shall be punished by
a fine not exceeding one hundred dollars ($100.00) excluding costs for each
offense and each sale shall constitute a separate offense. (Ord. 912 §1, 2000)
